Improve this resume bullet:
""Competitive pay, investment in you and your career to help you earn even higher pay and more senior roles, and potential immigration to our countries of office. Sound good? Read on.We believe in a lot of things. Moving daily. Flossing (the thread kind). Having dance parties. Above all, we believe in self-empowerment, positive inner-development and living a life of possibility. A career with us is more than what you do today; it’s what you’re going to do tomorrow.Who We Are:We as an organization exist because America is critically divided, socially and economically, holding everyone back.Our vision is an America moving forward together, united around a common health, opportunity, and dignity.Our work starts in the least resourced neighbourhoods of rural America, where our leaders and constituents have overcome the deepest poverty, racism, and educational gaps in America, with much less assistance than what’s available in urban America.Our boards and leadership are diverse in experience, viewpoint, and identity, and united in respect and vision. Board members joined us out of alignment and trust, and are not paid. Staff are not paid more than the US median average household income, and we are ranked in the top 10% of charities in the US by third parties using industry-standard rubrics and audited data.Who You Are:You will be one of the foundations of success as an organization. You are expert in graphic design, imagery, branding, messaging, and the like. You create beautiful, meaningful moving messaging in a single frame. You can take a project and run with it. In your application or first message, make sure to mention the word fuchsia to show you read this. You deliver this by having world-class organization, communication, positivity, and energy, sharing an optimism that you can do anything given to you, no matter the task or time.30 images like this. Specifically, 10 versions of red/white/black frames in the same colors, style/aesthetic that you will placed around/above 30 black and white images we give you (sample attached) instead of your own image (the female student holding the pencil). Your quote for 30 images as described will be compared with other remaining candidates and a decision will be made.You will make 10 white/black/red frames like you did for the mock image. We will give you 30 photographs like the one we just did above. You will put the frames you created on the 30 images, spreading the 10 our over 30 images so each frame should be used 3 times.Sounds like a lot right? It is. It's too much. And that's why tackling this while being part of a world-class team will be so much fun.Compensation will be competitive, and the rewards for you will be more transformative than dollars in your pocket. Though hey, those early morning coffees aren't free.We don't take ourselves seriously, but we do take our work seriously. Your first assignment will be this application, and we look forward to meeting you.Please note the attached image as an example (the images you create will be without a human).Budget: $65Posted On: February 14, 2024 06:36 UTCCategory: Graphic DesignSkills:Adobe PhotoshopSkills: Adobe PhotoshopCountry: United States""
Delivered competitive, pay, investment-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.

Improve this resume bullet:
""A business flyer is a printed or digital promotional material designed to convey key information about a business, its products, services, or events to a target audience. Here's a description of a typical business flyer:Title: [Business Name] Flyer**Front Side:**1. **Eye-catching Visual**: The front side of the flyer features a visually appealing image or graphic relevant to the business or its offerings. This could be a high-quality photograph, illustration, or graphic design element that grabs the viewer's attention and sets the tone for the flyer.2. **Compelling Headline**: A concise and attention-grabbing headline prominently displayed near the top of the flyer. The headline should succinctly communicate the main message or offer of the business, enticing the viewer to learn more.3. **Key Information**: Beneath the headline, the flyer includes essential information about the business, such as its name, logo, contact details (phone number, email address, website), and physical address (if applicable).4. **Benefits and Features**: A brief section highlighting the key benefits or features of the business, product, or service being promoted. This could include unique selling points, special offers, discounts, or other incentives to attract potential customers.5. **Call to Action (CTA)**: A clear and actionable CTA encouraging the viewer to take the next step, such as "Call Now," "Visit Our Website," "Shop Now," or "Learn More." The CTA is typically emphasized with bold text or a contrasting color to make it stand out.**Back Side:**1. **Detailed Information**: The back side of the flyer provides more detailed information about the business, its products, services, or upcoming events. This could include descriptions, features, pricing, testimonials, or any other relevant details that help potential customers make informed decisions.2. **Visual Continuity**: Continuation of the visual theme established on the front side of the flyer to maintain brand consistency and reinforce the overall message.3. **Contact Information**: Additional contact information, social media handles, or QR codes that allow viewers to easily connect with the business or access more information online.4. **Visual Hierarchy**: Organized layout with clear headings, bullet points, and subheadings to guide the reader's eye through the information and highlight key points effectively.5. **Branding Elements**: Incorporation of brand colors, fonts, logos, and other branding elements to reinforce brand identity and create a cohesive look and feel.Overall, a well-designed business flyer effectively captures the attention of its target audience, communicates key messages clearly and persuasively, and motivates viewers to take action, whether it's contacting the business, making a purchase, or attending an event.Budget: $5Posted On: February 22, 2024 23:56 UTCCategory: Graphic DesignSkills:Flyer DesignSkills: Flyer DesignCountry: India""
